title: Toil and trouble
creator_contributor_role: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, production facilities
abstract: A social commentary performed in mime of today's IR laws
description: When the warehouse boss lowers the overheads, Bronwen fights back and earns a black belt in Industrial Relations. Produced in the style of the silent era, and performed in mime, this short story also contains a social political message of today's IR laws in Australia. Music soundtrack with English intertitles. Music by Donna Coleman (pianist), Disasteradio and The Raskolnikovs. Warning: contains coarse language.
